definitions: Operate and control the direction and speed of a motor vehicle.
Propel or carry along, especially by force.
Force (someone or something) to move in a particular direction.
Cause (a person or animal) to work hard.
Provide the power to operate (a machine or device).
examples: The wind drove the rain against the window.
He drove the cattle to the market.
The boss drives his employees hard.
A small motor drives the pump.
